It will transfer data at a higher bandwidth but it won't transfer data 'faster' since radio waves and light both travel at exactly the same speed. Should have described it as transferring the data in less time.  Headline gives the impression that laser beams somehow travel faster than radio waves.  They just carry more information at one time, but at exactly the same speed.

replies.context: thanks for the clarification

The download rate is faster because the bandwidth is much higher. It's high school science that you can't transmit data faster than light until you get into quantum physics which has not evolved to a practical level.
Fox doesn‚Äôt exaggerate

The title clearly refers to the data transfer, not the speed of the signal.  While radio waves and laser light both travel at the speed of light, their payloads are significantly different.  A layman's (layperson's?) example, using the lower bound (10x), if it takes 1 minute to transfer a movie file by laser, it would take 10 minutes to transfer the same file via radio wave ... therefore as stated in the title, space lasers enable faster transfer of data.

Here's a clue to the writer, lasers and radio waves are the same thing.  Lasers are more tightly focused and happen to be broadcasting usually at a frequency we can see.  The tight focusing is what makes this form of radio more efficient in that you are not wasting energy by radiating away from your target.  Oh, and  SpaceX has been testing lasers for communicating between satellites for some time now.
